protocol.description:
This protocol exposes libinput device configuration APIs. The libinput documentation should be referred to for detailed information on libinput's behavior.
This protocol is designed so that (hopefully) any backwards compatible change to libinput's API can be matched with a backwards compatible change to this protocol.
Note: the libinput API uses floating point types (float and double in C) which are not (yet?) natively supported by the Wayland protocol. However, the Wayland protocol does support sending arbitrary bytes through the array argument type. This protocol uses e.g. type="array" summary="double" to indicate a native-endian IEEE-754 64-bit double value.
The key words "must", "must not", "required", "shall", "shall not", "should", "should not", "recommended", "may", and "optional" in this document are to be interpreted as described in IETF RFC 2119.

interface.name: river_libinput_config_v1
interface.description: Global interface for configuring libinput devices. This global should only be advertised if river_input_manager_v1 is advertised as well.

request.name: stop
request.description:
This request indicates that the client no longer wishes to receive events on this object.
The Wayland protocol is asynchronous, which means the server may send further events until the stop request is processed. The client must wait for a river_libinput_config_v1.finished event before destroying this object.

event.name: finished

description.summary: the server has finished with the object

event.description: This event indicates that the server will send no further events on this object. The client should destroy the object. See river_libinput_config_v1.destroy for more information.

request.name: destroy
request.description:
This request should be called after the finished event has been received to complete destruction of the object.
It is a protocol error to make this request before the finished event has been received.
If a client wishes to destroy this object it should send a river_libinput_config_v1.stop request and wait for a river_libinput_config_v1.finished event. Once the finished event is received it is safe to destroy this object and any other objects created through this interface.

event.name: libinput_device
event.description: A new libinput device has been created. Not every river_input_device_v1 is necessarily a libinput device as well.

request.name: create_accel_config
request.description: Create a acceleration config which can be applied with river_libinput_device_v1.apply_accel_config.

interface.name: river_libinput_device_v1
interface.description: In general, *_support events will be sent exactly once directly after the river_libinput_device_v1 is created. *_default events will be sent after *_support events if the config option is supported, and *_current events willl be sent after the *_default events and again whenever the config option is changed.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request indicates that the client will no longer use the input device object and that it may be safely destroyed.

event.name: removed
event.description:
This event indicates that the libinput device has been removed.
The server will send no further events on this object and ignore any request (other than river_libinput_device_v1.destroy) made after this event is sent. The client should destroy this object with the river_libinput_device_v1.destroy request to free up resources.

event.name: input_device
event.description: The river_input_device_v1 corresponding to this libinput device. This event will always be the first event sent on the river_libinput_device_v1 object, and it will be sent exactly once.

request.name: set_send_events
request.description: Set the send events mode for the device.

event.name: tap_support
event.description: The number of fingers supported for tap-to-click/drag. If finger_count is 0, tap-to-click and drag are unsupported.

request.name: set_tap
request.description: Configure tap-to-click on this device, with a default mapping of 1, 2, 3 finger tap mapping to left, right, middle click, respectively.

request.name: set_tap_button_map
request.description: Set the finger number to button number mapping for tap-to-click. The default mapping on most devices is to have a 1, 2 and 3 finger tap to map to the left, right and middle button, respectively.

request.name: set_drag
request.description: Configure tap-and-drag functionality on the device.

request.name: set_drag_lock
request.description: Configure drag-lock during tapping on this device. When enabled, a finger may be lifted and put back on the touchpad and the drag process continues. A timeout for lifting the finger is optional. When disabled, lifting the finger during a tap-and-drag will immediately stop the drag. See the libinput documentation for more details.

event.name: three_finger_drag_support
event.description: The number of fingers supported for three/four finger drag. If finger_count is less than 3, three finger drag is unsupported.

request.name: set_three_finger_drag
request.description: Configure three finger drag functionality for the device.

event.name: calibration_matrix_support
event.description: A calibration matrix is supported if the supported argument is non-zero.

request.name: set_calibration_matrix
request.description: Set calibration matrix.

request.name: set_accel_profile
request.description: Set the acceleration profile.

request.name: set_accel_speed
request.description: Set the acceleration speed within a range of [-1, 1], where 0 is the default acceleration for this device, -1 is the slowest acceleration and 1 is the maximum acceleration available on this device.

request.name: apply_accel_config
request.description: Apply a pointer accleration config.

event.name: natural_scroll_support
event.description: Natural scroll is supported if the supported argument is non-zero.

request.name: set_natural_scroll
request.description: Set natural scroll state.

event.name: left_handed_support
event.description: Left-handed mode is supported if the supported argument is non-zero.

request.name: set_left_handed
request.description: Set left-handed mode state.

event.name: click_method_support
event.description: The click methods supported by the device.

request.name: set_click_method
request.description: Set click method.

event.name: clickfinger_button_map_default
event.description: Default clickfinger button map. Supported if click_methods.clickfinger is supported.

event.name: clickfinger_button_map_current
event.description: Current clickfinger button map. Supported if click_methods.clickfinger is supported.

request.name: set_clickfinger_button_map
request.description: Set clickfinger button map. Supported if click_methods.clickfinger is supported.

event.name: middle_emulation_support

description.summary: support for middle mouse button emulation

event.description: Middle mouse button emulation is supported if the supported argument is non-zero.

description.summary: current middle mouse button emulation state

request.name: set_middle_emulation

description.summary: set middle mouse button emulation state

request.description: Set middle mouse button emulation state.

event.name: scroll_method_support
event.description: The scroll methods supported by the device.

request.name: set_scroll_method
request.description: Set scroll method.

event.name: scroll_button_default
event.description: Default scroll button. Supported if scroll_methods.on_button_down is supported.

event.name: scroll_button_current
event.description: Current scroll button. Supported if scroll_methods.on_button_down is supported.

request.name: set_scroll_button
request.description: Set scroll button. Supported if scroll_methods.on_button_down is supported.

event.name: scroll_button_lock_default
event.description: Default scroll button lock state. Supported if scroll_methods.on_button_down is supported.

event.name: scroll_button_lock_current
event.description: Current scroll button lock state. Supported if scroll_methods.on_button_down is supported.

request.name: set_scroll_button_lock
request.description: Set scroll button lock state. Supported if scroll_methods.on_button_down is supported.

event.name: dwt_support
event.description: Disable-while-typing is supported if the supported argument is non-zero.

request.name: set_dwt
request.description: Set disable-while-typing state.

event.name: dwtp_support
event.description: Disable-while-trackpointing is supported if the supported argument is non-zero.

request.name: set_dwtp
request.description: Set disable-while-trackpointing state.

event.name: rotation_support
event.description: Rotation is supported if the supported argument is non-zero.

request.name: set_rotation
request.description: Set rotation angle in degrees clockwise off the logical neutral position. Angle must be in the range [0-360).

interface.name: river_libinput_accel_config_v1
interface.description: The result returned by libinput on setting configuration for a device.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request indicates that the client will no longer use the accel config object and that it may be safely destroyed.

request.name: set_points
request.description: Defines the acceleration function for a given movement type in an acceleration configuration with custom accel profile.

interface.name: river_libinput_result_v1
interface.description: The result returned by libinput on setting configuration for a device.

event.name: success
event.description: The configuration was successfully applied to the device.

event.name: unsupported
event.description: The configuration is unsupported by the device and was ignored.

event.name: invalid
event.description: The configuration is invalid and was ignored.
